question: Question_01_(e)
statement:
Short-Answer Questions. Put your answer in the box provided but show
your work also. Each question is worth 3 marks, but not all questions
are of equal difficulty.

Evaluate $\int_{-1}^{2}|2x|\,dx$ .
sols:
Because of the absolute value in the integral, we need to split it at
\emph{0}.

\begin{align*}
\displaystyle \int_{-1}^2|2x|dx &= \int_{-1}^0-2xdx + \int_0^22xdx\\
&= -[x^2]_{-1}^0 + [x^2]_0^2\\
&= -(0^2 - (-1)^2) + (2^2 - 0^2)\\
&= 1 + 4 = 5\end{align*}
hints:
Be careful with the absolute value in the integral! You need to splits
the integral at \emph{0}.
